zone.line: something
Then we were all in all, 'twas indeed worth
One's while to be in place & wear a star
That was indeed the golden age on earth
Parvenu
We too are active, & we did & do
What we ought not perhaps, & yet we now
Will seize, whilst all things are whirled round
& round
A spoke of Fortunes wheel & keep our ground.
Author
Who now can taste a treatise of deep sense
And ponderous volume? 'tis impertinence
To write what none will read, & therefore will I
To please the young & thoughtless people
try
Mephistoles — Who at once appears to
have grown very old)
I find the people ripe for the last day
Since I last came up to the wizard mountain
And as my little cask runs turbid now
So is the world drained to the dregs
